Skeletons.synopsis: Animated skeleton of MyrkulThe skeletons don' talk, they don't have the animations. It's doable, but should be thought through and requested, then the scripting will have to change too.

PAD_TownVista.synopsis: On Moonrise's Rooftop. Vista of TWN and beyond that, HAV and SCL

Ketheric.how_to_trigger: oe fullaudienceoe unlockrooftopoe mooaudience_tadpoleThen walk all the way up to the top of MOOTriggered when you approach Ketheric on the Moonrise rooftop

AD_RoofGreeting.synopsis: Player was allowed an audience with Ketheric. Myrkul cultist spots them and greets them as they approach

WaitingKetheric.synopsis: Audience path, which means Nightsong was captured in SHA. Ketheric is on the roof. This is afterthe bigger interactive dialog - when the player must go to the altar
WaitingKetheric.how_to_trigger: Capture Nightsong in SHA.Kidnap or Kill IsobelTalk to Z'rell, gain access to roof

AD_Ketheric.synopsis: Audience path, which means Nightsong was captured in SHA. Ketheric is on the roof. This is before the bigger interactive dialog starts.Ketheric is directing some of these are nameless minions.
AD_Ketheric.how_to_trigger: Capture Nightsong in SHA.Kill IsobelTalk to Z'rell, gain access to roof

Altar.synopsis: Player completed Z'rell's tasks and was granted the Audience. Ketheric told them to kneel at the altar. The tentacle will touch them and teleport them
Altar.how_to_trigger: Capture NighstongKidnap or Kill IsobelTalk to Zrell and get access to the roofTalk to Ketheric, then click on altar

AD_MumblingSul.synopsis: Sul acts as wine servent to Ketheric. He speaks in riddles, he mind clearly filled by the fog of the Elder Brain, boarderline thrall.
AD_MumblingSul.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Aoe mooausience_tadpoleoe mootoroofStand near Sul

RoofTransgression.synopsis: Ketheric sees players on roof before anything has taken place. Ketheric is displeased with
RoofTransgression.how_to_trigger: Go to the roof in MOO default state. Ignore warnings and walk up to Ketheric when he's on the roof.

AccessCultist.synopsis: The Mistress of Souls won't let us pass into Ketheric's chapel until we've completed MOO quests. Her tone is vaguely respectful, but not as deferential as a True Soul is used to. When we press her on this, we'll see her contempt - True Souls might be a big deal out in the world, but not here. In truth, she is a Myrkul cultist playing her role in the church of the Absolute, secretly contemptuous of every true believer.
AccessCultist.how_to_trigger: go to -162; 37; -203 and speak to Radija

RoofCultist.synopsis: Cultist is on the roof, so the player meets them only if they have access to the roof through the Audience path (the 'evil' path, completing Z'rell's Tasks). They greet the player to the roof (the chapel)
RoofCultist.how_to_trigger: Exit onto Moonrise's rooftop. If we have permission, her one-liners will trigger. If we do not, her interactive scene will trigger.

Skeletons_0.speaker: Narrator
Skeletons_0.text: *You think you hear a whisper - but perhaps it was just wind draughting through a dull and empty thing.*
Skeletons_0.context: NodeContext: Not sure if "draughting" is correct usage but feels good for this moment - creepy wind creepily sighing through a creepy skeleton

Skeletons_1.speaker: Narrator
Skeletons_1.text: *Wide gaping sockets that see nothing - and still they seem to watch you.*

PAD_TownVista_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TownVista_0.text: This must have been quite a view, once.

Ketheric_24.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_24.text: I'll tell you a story, True Soul. About a man who sold himself piece by piece.

Ketheric_108.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_108.text: He had... everything. A wonderful wife. A brilliant daughter. They lived not far from here.

Ketheric_110.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_110.text: His wife died too young. Grief tore through their home like a thief, snatching away the scent of her hair, the rustle of her skirts. But the man did not break.

Ketheric_35.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_35.text: He could not break. His daughter needed him whole, after all.

Ketheric_87.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_87.text: She grew up - grew strong. Challenged him. Filled his heart with such joy it supplanted all sorrow.

Ketheric_16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_16.text: When she was killed, the man... he tried to remain whole, but it wasn't possible. Do you understand?

Ketheric_34.speaker: Player
Ketheric_34.text: So the man fell to pieces.

Ketheric_96.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_96.text: The pain was unbearable. All-consuming. He decided he'd do anything for reprieve.

Ketheric_60.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_60.text: First, he sold himself to the goddess of loss. But the pain did not subside, no matter his obscene feats of devotion.

Ketheric_125.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_125.text: Then a new god came - a god who promised the man something wonderful: his daughter. Her life returned. Imagine it.

Ketheric_66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_66.text: He would have to give everything: his body and soul entire. He did not hesitate. Not for a moment.

Ketheric_52.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_52.text: And the new god did as promised. The man's brilliant, beautiful daughter came back. She was whole - she was alive. But she despised the pitiful wretch her father had become.

Ketheric_51.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_51.text: Her hatred he could bear, perhaps, as long as she had another chance to live.

Ketheric_74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_74.text: Everything I've done, everything I have built, has been to give Isobel that chance. And you, True Soul - you have squandered it.

Ketheric_129.speaker: Player
Ketheric_129.text: I didn't know Isobel was your daughter, General. I submit myself to your judgement.

Ketheric_78.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_78.text: Not my judgement. Be glad for that, True Soul.

Ketheric_109.speaker: Player
Ketheric_109.text: You brought her back once. Do it again.

Ketheric_63.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_63.text: I can. I will. But it is not without cost. Who will pay this time, True Soul?

Ketheric_86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_86.text: I have no mercy left in me - but it is for the Absolute to decide your fate.
Ketheric_86.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

Ketheric_83.speaker: Player
Ketheric_83.text: She opposed the Absolute. Why mourn her?

Ketheric_79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_79.text: Every god I have served, I have served in my daughter's name. And it almost came to nothing because of you.

Ketheric_75.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_75.text: I've retrieved my daughter's body - the one you so ruthlessly injured. She will live again. I want you to pay for what you've done.

Ketheric_1.speaker: Player
Ketheric_1.text: Sorry about the cleric, but I'm here for an audience with the Absolute.

Ketheric_14.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_14.text: You had best dredge up some scrap of respect, True Soul. You will need it.

Ketheric_45.speaker: Player
Ketheric_45.text: Vengeance is the best antidote to grief.

Ketheric_122.speaker: Player
Ketheric_122.text: It's subtle, but let me guess - the man is you.

Ketheric_54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_54.text: So you understand what you have cost me, True Soul?

Ketheric_92.speaker: Player
Ketheric_92.text: Does it matter? No sad story can undo the things you've done.

Ketheric_47.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_47.text: The things we have done, True Soul.

Ketheric_36.speaker: Player
Ketheric_36.text: What is this? I came to receive my audience with the Absolute.

Ketheric_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_4.text: You will listen. You will understand what you have cost me.

Ketheric_81.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_81.text: I pledged my body and soul entire to a new god: a god who promised me my daughter could be returned to me.

Ketheric_32.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_32.text: True Soul! I was so hoping to thank you in person.
Ketheric_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric spots the player, opening his arms wide. InternalNodeContext: Player helped kidnapped IsobelNodeContext: Ketheric spots the player, opening his arms wide.

Ketheric_13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_13.text: You've had your indiscretions, but I find I can forgive a great deal in light of what you've done.

Ketheric_77.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_77.text: Our forces are gathered, the Nightsong bound, and we are ready to march at last. But most importantly...

Ketheric_21.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_21.text: Isobel. You brought my daughter back to me.

Ketheric_115.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_115.text: She's being introduced to the Absolute as we speak. Soon it will be as though we were never apart. You have our thanks for your part in our reunion.

Ketheric_71.speaker: Player
Ketheric_71.text: It was an honour to serve, my lord.

Ketheric_43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_43.text: I'm sure it was. Though I can't imagine convincing Isobel to come to the Towers was an easy feat.

Ketheric_91.speaker: Player
Ketheric_91.text: You're Isobel's father? She wasn't overly keen on a reunion.

Ketheric_25.speaker: Player
Ketheric_25.text: She wasn't overly keen on a reunion.

Ketheric_42.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_42.text: She was always stubborn. She clung to Selûne even after her mother's death.

Ketheric_9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_9.text: Ironic, then, that it was Isobel who drove me into Shar's arms. She died, and I was left alone.

Ketheric_84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_84.text: I made perfect prey for Lady Loss. She promised vengeance. Oblivion. But her plans came to naught.

Ketheric_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_0.text: Only one god empowered me to bring my Isobel back. That is the god I serve now. The god we serve.

Ketheric_127.speaker: Player
Ketheric_127.text: So Isobel was dead, and you resurrected her?

Ketheric_22.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_22.text: From darkness into light. From oblivion back into her father's arms.

Ketheric_62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_62.text: In the end, perhaps her death was a boon - an encouragement to point me toward our higher purpose.

Ketheric_26.speaker: Player
Ketheric_26.text: I'm not sure Isobel would see it that way.

Ketheric_64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_64.text: You're wrong. But you'll discover that for yourself, when you meet the Absolute.

Ketheric_89.speaker: Player
Ketheric_89.text: And I've served well. I've come to claim my reward.

Ketheric_56.speaker: Player
Ketheric_56.text: So you serve whichever god best serves you. A skewed philosophy.

Ketheric_100.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_100.text: I'll keep her close. Aylin was her name - an angel of Selûne's own brood, sent to guide and guard my line. Until she failed me.

Ketheric_6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_6.text: Now she is Nightsong. Balthazar's greatest creation, and the source of my greatest strength.

Ketheric_37.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_37.text: How often our burdens can be made into boons, with the right encouragement.

Ketheric_103.speaker: Player
Ketheric_103.text: Speaking of boons - I think I've earned one of my own.

Ketheric_29.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_29.text: That you have. That and more, True Soul.

Ketheric_112.speaker: Player
Ketheric_112.text: Every god you served granted you power in their way. Hardly a burden.

Ketheric_101.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_101.text: A free tongue. You've earned that much, I suppose. But I do not have to explain myself.

Ketheric_73.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_73.text: You played your part. Don't spurn your reward just as you've earned it.

Ketheric_132.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_132.text: It's time for you to learn true power. Make use of my own altar. Kneel in Her name, and the Absolute will come.

Ketheric_30.speaker: Player
Ketheric_30.text: I am ready to meet with the Absolute - if you'll permit it.

Ketheric_98.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_98.text: It is not for me to permit. You have earned this right.

Ketheric_61.speaker: Player
Ketheric_61.text: I want to see the truth of this god. What's next?

Ketheric_39.speaker: Player
Ketheric_39.text: I only hope your daughter can embrace the Absolute's will.

Ketheric_68.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_68.text: No one of sound mind can look at what the Absolute offers and resist.

Ketheric_121.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_121.text: But I know it wasn't easy for Isobel to accept how our family has changed.

Ketheric_93.speaker: Player
Ketheric_93.text: Taking Isobel was a mistake. I've come here to correct it.

Ketheric_69.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_69.text: You think to take Isobel from me again? Why, True Soul? Why come here just to die?
Ketheric_69.context: NodeContext: Pre combat, Ketheric is about to fight the player.

Ketheric_8.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_8.text: Make no mistake, that was always your fate. But I had hoped to make it painless.

Ketheric_95.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_95.text: I've heard a great deal about you, True Soul.
Ketheric_95.context: InternalNodeContext: NS captured but Isobel not captured

Ketheric_85.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_85.text: Indeed, I'd have thrown you off this tower by now if I didn't want to have a little chat first.

Ketheric_106.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_106.text: You've travelled a long way to make it here. Lied. Fought. Even attacked me, who you ought to serve.

Ketheric_44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_44.text: You've travelled a long way to make it here. Lied. Fought. Killed - even those who would be your allies.

Ketheric_27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_27.text: You've travelled a long way to make it this far. Lied. Fought. Killed.

Ketheric_17.speaker: Player
Ketheric_17.text: I am devoted to the Absolute.

Ketheric_19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_19.text: If that were true, the Selûnite cleric would be standing next to me right this moment. Instead, Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you - you're here, before me, for some unfathomable reason.
Ketheric_19.context: NodeContext: Alt take: "If that were true, you would not bring chaos to my dominion. Disciple Z'rell is dead, and you have come to me empty-handed, and uninvited."

Ketheric_28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_28.text: You're not like the others. Holy fervour does not motivate you. Nor does the promise of ultimate reward. How very sad for you.

Ketheric_59.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_59.text: If that were true, the Selûnite cleric would be standing next to me right this moment. Z'rell gave you an order - an order on my behalf - and you failed it.
Ketheric_59.context: NodeContext: Alt true: "If that were true, you would have delivered the Selunite cleric as Z'rell instructed you to do."

Ketheric_23.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_23.text: If that were true, you would have reported to Z'rell as you were told, you would have stayed off this roof as you were told, and you would be out there retrieving the Selûnite cleric!
Ketheric_23.context: NodeContext: Alt true: "If that were true, you would have reported to Z'rell as instructed rather than interrupting a private ceremony."

Ketheric_72.speaker: Player
Ketheric_72.text: I'd do whatever it takes to gain an audience with the Absolute.

Ketheric_46.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_46.text: And yet Isobel - the Selûnite cleric - is nowhere to be found. Z'rell instructed you quite clearly.

Ketheric_58.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_58.text: Who are you to defy the Absolute's orders? My orders?

Ketheric_104.speaker: Player
Ketheric_104.text: I brought you the Nightsong - just as you asked.

Ketheric_70.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_70.text: Half marks means you fail, True Soul.

Ketheric_67.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_67.text: The Absolute will decide your fate.
Ketheric_67.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

Ketheric_97.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_97.text: Kneel before the Absolute's altar. Throw yourself at Her mercy. Or try to earn Her forgiveness by retrieving the cleric Isobel. Your choice.

Ketheric_33.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_33.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

Ketheric_10.speaker: Player
Ketheric_10.text: What can I do to atone for my failure?

Ketheric_131.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_131.text: Until the cleric is at my side, you are nothing. And you will be nothing until the Absolute cures you of the sin of your own mind.

Ketheric_57.speaker: Player
Ketheric_57.text: What could the Absolute possibly want with the cleric?

Ketheric_114.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_114.text: Not only do you fail to carry out your orders, but you wish to question the Absolute?

Ketheric_18.speaker: Player
Ketheric_18.text: She didn't want to be brought here, General. She fears you.

Ketheric_50.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_50.text: That is precisely why I sent you to retrieve her! She is lost. Confused. It is your holy duty to help me enlighten her.
Ketheric_50.context: NodeContext: Shouting, the pinnacle of his rage.

Ketheric_49.speaker: Player
Ketheric_49.text: She's your daughter, isn't she? Isobel Thorm. She fears you.

Ketheric_2.speaker: Player
Ketheric_2.text: I thought you'd be angrier about my slaughter of your faithful.
Ketheric_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has massacred Z'rell and others to get here.

Ketheric_5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_5.text: Death will only strengthen their faith, and you had no orders to spare them. Your orders were to retrieve Isobel.

Ketheric_38.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_38.text: Either go back out there and retrieve the cleric, or kneel at the altar. See if the Absolute cares to explain Herself to you.

Ketheric_48.speaker: Player
Ketheric_48.text: I could ask the same of you.

Ketheric_76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_76.text: My motivations are clear, aren't they? I serve the Absolute.

Ketheric_107.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_107.text: But you - you have defied Her will and my orders. Balthazar instructed you to retrieve the Selûnite cleric, but instead you are here questioning me!

Ketheric_99.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_99.text: But you - you have defied Her will. You failed to take Isobel - the Selûnite cleric. Indeed, True Soul, she is nowhere to be found.

Ketheric_7.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric_7.text: But you - you have defied Her will and my orders. You were to report to Disciple Z'rell. You were to aid my cause! Instead you're here, showing your worthless face to me.

AD_RoofGreeting_0.speaker: Susdera
AD_RoofGreeting_0.text: There you are. Come forward, True Soul.

WaitingKetheric_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
WaitingKetheric_0.text: You've come here for a reason. See it through. Kneel at the altar. The Absolute will answer.
WaitingKetheric_0.context: NodeContext: Neutral/ cold - Isobel isn't here with him and he's pissed.

WaitingKetheric_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
WaitingKetheric_1.text: It's time to finish what you started. Kneel at the altar.

WaitingKetheric_3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
WaitingKetheric_3.text: It's too late to change your mind now, True Soul.
WaitingKetheric_3.context: NodeContext: Neutral/ cold - Isobel isn't here with him and he's pissed.

WaitingKetheric_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
WaitingKetheric_4.text: Don't hesitate, True Soul. You deserve to meet her.
WaitingKetheric_4.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic. Ketheric got everything he wanted.

WaitingKetheric_5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
WaitingKetheric_5.text: Kneel at the altar. The Absolute is waiting. And Her gifts are very, very real.
WaitingKetheric_5.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic. Ketheric got everything he wanted.

Altar_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player slowly kneels at altar

Altar_17.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_17.text: Come then, True Soul. Let us pray. Hear us, Absolute!
Altar_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric crosses to stand alone at the centre of the roof, beneath the raised altar. He raises his hand, and a ring on his fist flares with light.

Altar_9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_9.text: For your sake, True Soul, I pray Her judgement is swift. Hear us, Absolute!
Altar_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric crosses to stand alone at the centre of the roof, beneath the raised altar. He raises his hand, and a ring on his fis flares with light.

Altar_3.speaker: Altar of Absolute Ascension
Altar_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kneeling at altar, reacting to sudden intimate whisper

Altar_15.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_15.text: Do you feel Her? Let Her in, True Soul. Claim your reward.
Altar_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arms still raised, a smirk growing on his lips

Altar_13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide, front shot of the altar. Framed against the night sky behind the player, a vast tentacle rises unseen.

Altar_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle LASHES down, but is stopped short. The player rises, the ARTEFACT shining in the air before them. The tentacle squirms as if trapped by the light.

Altar_18.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_18.text: ...The Prism. I scour this land in search of it, and you bring it to my door?

Altar_2.speaker: Altar of Absolute Ascension
Altar_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle is easing forward now, as if inquisitiveNodeContext: growing excitement

Altar_12.speaker: Altar of Absolute Ascension
Altar_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: twitching violently, it inches towards us - straining violently against Ketheric's control

Altar_14.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_14.text: ENOUGH! If you cannot take it, then take them. Balthazar will find a way.

Altar_10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ring raised, anger in his voice. The tentacle finally makes contact with us, and we fade to white - teleported down into the colony.

Altar_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tentacle has teleported the player. Fade in to show player 'coming to' in a cage in Balthazar's chamber. The necromancer notices us, turning around.

Altar_11.speaker: Balthazar
Altar_11.text: Ah, you're awake. Good. General Thorm has tasked me with relieving you of a certain artefact - I hear it's loath to part from you.
Altar_11.context: NodeContext: Keen, like he's been waiting for the player to come-to

Altar_0.speaker: Balthazar
Altar_0.text: No matter - I do enjoy a challenge, and I have more than a few tools to experiment with.
Altar_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar gestures broadly at his surrounding labNodeContext: Relishing this

Altar_7.speaker: Narrator
Altar_7.text: *Once Balthazar is through with you, you will be left as just another undead thrall - unless you can stop him in time.*

Altar_16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_16.text: You needn't beg for mercy, True Soul. The Absolute is not like other gods.
Altar_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arms still raised, a smirk growing on his lips

Altar_19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Altar_19.text: She always gives Her faithful exactly what they deserve.
Altar_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide, front shot of the altar. Framed against the night sky behind the player, a vast tentacle rises unseen.

AD_MumblingSul_0.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul_0.text: Cleric of the moon, alas! Too soon for the Chosen.

AD_MumblingSul_1.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul_1.text: The moving stone sings so softly...

AD_MumblingSul_2.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul_2.text: Time and patience... in her time...

AD_MumblingSul_3.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul_3.text: Great dark, great light, and in it... her.

RoofTransgression_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_0.text: Curious. I believe you were told to wait.

RoofTransgression_8.speaker: Player
RoofTransgression_8.text: I need an audience with you.

RoofTransgression_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_1.text: You needed to heed the instructions you were given.

RoofTransgression_7.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_7.text: A soldier who cannot follow orders is of no use to me. Goodbye.

RoofTransgression_3.speaker: Player
RoofTransgression_3.text: My apologies, General. Please forgive my intrusion.

RoofTransgression_6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_6.text: It isn't for me to forgive one who so flouts the Absolute's will.

RoofTransgression_5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_5.text: It is for me to punish them.

RoofTransgression_4.speaker: Player
RoofTransgression_4.text: Ketheric Thorm, prepare to meet your maker.

RoofTransgression_2.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression_2.text: Tsk. Smiting a fool is never as satisfying as one hopes it will be.

AccessCultist_18.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_18.text: Go. The General awaits - and so does She.
AccessCultist_18.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.

AccessCultist_20.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_20.text: It is not your time yet, blessed one.
AccessCultist_20.context: NodeContext: Looking us up and down, unimpressed but (barely) polite. Main note for entire dialogue is a customer service worker who knows they have to be polite, but secretly hates you.

AccessCultist_32.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_32.text: The rooftop chapel is reserved for the General's private contemplation - save for those he chooses to ascend.
AccessCultist_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the doorsNodeContext: Polite facade, but secretly enjoying telling us we're not so special

AccessCultist_0.text: This must be the place. We have to get inside.

AccessCultist_23.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_23.text: I've heard that those lucky few come back changed.

AccessCultist_12.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_12.text: You are already changed, True Soul. Hearing Her voice is what brought you here.
AccessCultist_12.context: NodeContext: Nodding, but unimpressed by our pulling rank. She's about to explain that being a True Soul is not special in her eyes

AccessCultist_1.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_1.text: But above, you will stand in Her very presence. Such an honour requires... more.

AccessCultist_21.speaker: Narrator
AccessCultist_21.text: *Her words are diplomatic, but her face betrays her true feelings: utter contempt, for you and all your kind.*

AccessCultist_25.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_25.text: Disciple Z'rell will give you a chance to earn that honour.
AccessCultist_25.context: NodeContext: Fixed smile, a little patronising

AccessCultist_11.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_11.text: Disciple Z'rell has given you a chance to earn that honour.
AccessCultist_11.context: NodeContext: Fixed smile, a little patronising

AccessCultist_19.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_19.text: Prove you are ready. Reach out for her tadpole.

AccessCultist_3.speaker: Narrator
AccessCultist_3.text: *Your tadpole grasps at nothing. She carries no parasite.*
AccessCultist_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show the player exiting mindmeld

AccessCultist_27.speaker: Narrator
AccessCultist_27.text: *But there is recognition of another kind between you. The faint, fleeting odour of decay, as if both of you stand in an open grave.*
AccessCultist_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show the player inspecting the cultist

AccessCultist_41.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_41.text: Ah. You are one of the faithful.
AccessCultist_41.context: NodeContext: First hint of actual respect - you're a Myrkulite like her. But she's still keeping that affiliation secret.

AccessCultist_5.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_5.text: Then patience, blessed one. Our god always gives us answers - but sometimes they must be earned.
AccessCultist_5.context: NodeContext: First hint of actual respect - you're a Myrkulite like her. But she's still keeping that affiliation secret.

AccessCultist_2.speaker: Narrator
AccessCultist_2.text: *But you've spent too long reading people not to see what's behind her eyes: scorn, stark behind her mask of deference.*
AccessCultist_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show the player inspecting the cultist

AccessCultist_38.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_38.text: As you see, True Soul... there is so much more for you to learn.
AccessCultist_38.context: NodeContext: Knows that we just tried to dominate her mind, and will be thrown off balance by our failure

AccessCultist_31.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_31.text: I believe you will find your rightful place in Her design. Either you will ascend, or you will fall.
AccessCultist_31.context: NodeContext: Neutral - this could be reassurance or threat

AccessCultist_33.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_33.text: And I find use for even the fallen. I hope that is some comfort to you.
AccessCultist_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of skeletons standing guardNodeContext: Indicating the skeletons she's revived

AccessCultist_16.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_16.text: She is in council with the General below. Show proper respect, and perhaps you will be alive when we meet again.

AccessCultist_4.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_4.text: And if I choose to go anyway - will you stop me?

AccessCultist_34.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_34.text: I will not. Your fate is your own to choose - however painful.
AccessCultist_34.context: NodeContext: Unperturbed - not quite smug, but she knows we're not powerful enough to force our way to her boss

AccessCultist_39.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_39.text: What's with the skeletons? Does the Absolute dabble in necromancy now?

AccessCultist_13.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_13.text: Her design does not end at the grave, blessed one. You will serve, whether you ascend or fall.
AccessCultist_13.context: NodeContext: Neutral - this could be reassurance or threat

AccessCultist_28.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_28.text: Let me pass. I'm a True Soul.

AccessCultist_29.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_29.text: You hear Her word. That has brought you this far.
AccessCultist_29.context: NodeContext: Nodding, but unimpressed by our pulling rank. She's about to explain that being a True Soul is not special in her eyes

AccessCultist_8.speaker: Player
AccessCultist_8.text: And how is one chosen to ascend?

AccessCultist_24.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_24.text: I'm sure you have done a great many things to get this far, True Soul.
AccessCultist_24.context: NodeContext: Nodding, but unimpressed by our pulling rank. She's about to explain that being a True Soul is not special in her eyes

AccessCultist_35.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist_35.text: I have my duties, True Soul. I'm sure Disciple Z'rell has given you yours.

RoofCultist_9.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_9.text: You will turn around. Should the General learn you breached his private chapel, he will not be so merciful.
RoofCultist_9.context: NodeContext: The fact that we might refuse doesn't even enter her mind

RoofCultist_5.speaker: Player
RoofCultist_5.text: Do not come between a True Soul and the Absolute.

RoofCultist_10.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_10.text: Do you think yourself so important, True Soul? Until Z'rell says otherwise, you are beneath the Absolute's notice.
RoofCultist_10.context: NodeContext: Amused - we don't even know how little we are in her eyes

RoofCultist_13.speaker: Player
RoofCultist_13.text: I need to speak to the General.

RoofCultist_0.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_0.text: And he has need of obedience. Serve, True Soul - if Disciple Z'rell deems you worthy, you will ascend.
RoofCultist_0.context: NodeContext: Putting it right back on us

RoofCultist_2.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_2.text: Well. You will not be the first True Soul the General has thrown from this spot.
RoofCultist_2.context: NodeContext: Bored, combat will trigger after this. She knows she is much more powerful

RoofCultist_7.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_7.context: NodeContext: We've been cowed - that we wouldn't never even occured to her

RoofCultist_3.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_3.text: I received no word that a True Soul is to ascend.

RoofCultist_6.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_6.text: Heed the General's word. He is not only Her champion, but one of Her prophets as well.

RoofCultist_11.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_11.text: The Absolute bids you step forward, True Soul. She is so very close to us here.

RoofCultist_12.speaker: Susdera
RoofCultist_12.text: Kneel at the altar, True Soul. Kneel and rise anew.
